trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> class represents a connection to a DSML Gateway using SOAP over HTTP.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDirectoryIdentifier)"></xref> constructor initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies server for the connection.
identifier is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.#ctor(System.Uri)"></xref> constructor initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> object that specifies server for the connection.
uri is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDirectoryIdentifier,System.Net.NetworkCredential)"></xref> constructor initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies server for the connection.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> object that contains the network credentials.
identifier is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.#ctor(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDirectoryIdentifier,System.Net.NetworkCredential,System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType)"></xref> constructor creates and initializes a new instance of a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> class using the specified identifier, network credentials, and authentication type.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlDirectoryIdentifier"></xref> object that specifies the server for the connection.
A <xref href="System.Net.NetworkCredential"></xref> object that contains the Network Credentials.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType"></xref> value that specifies the authentication type to use for this connection.
identifier is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
authType value is not one of the DSML supported values.
DSML only supports Anonymous, Ntlm, Basic, Negotiate and digest.
authType value is not one of the constants defined in the enumeration.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.Abort(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method cancels the asynchronous request.
An object derived from <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that references the asynchronous request.
asyncResult is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
asyncResult was not returned by the corresponding call to .

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.AuthType"></xref> property contains one of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the authentication type.
One of the values of <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.AuthType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the authentication type.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.BeginSendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument,System.AsyncCallback,System.Object)"></xref> method begins asynchronously sending the specified <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object to the server.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object to send.
The <xref href="System.AsyncCallback"></xref> function.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that contains the state data for this request.
An object derived from <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that references the asynchronous send.
request is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.BeginSession"></xref> method instructs the DSML server to start a new session.
The method will block while waiting for a response from the DSML server and will time out according to the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.Timeout%2A> property.
Thrown when a session is already open on the connection.
Thrown when the XML returned from the Server in response to the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.BeginSession"></xref> is not well-formed.
Thrown when there is a communications failure with the DSML server or when the server is out of available sessions.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.EndSendRequest(System.IAsyncResult)"></xref> method completes an asynchronous send request.
An object derived from <xref href="System.IAsyncResult"></xref> that contains state data for this request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> object that contains the results of the request.
Thrown when asyncResult is `null`.
Thrown if asyncResult was not returned by the current instance from a call to .
The request did not complete.
No stream is available.
Thrown when the response returned by server is not valid.
Thrown when abort was previously called or when an error occurred while processing the request.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.EndSession"></xref> method ends the session with the DSML server and clears the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.SessionId"></xref> property.
The method will block while waiting for a response from the DSML server and will time out according to the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryConnection.Timeout%2A> property.
If the DSML server has already terminated the session on its own, a <xref:System.Net.WebException> will be thrown.

If the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.SessionId%2A> is still valid after the exception is thrown, the request never reached the server and the connection is still considered valid.
Thrown when there is a communications failure with the DSML server.
Thrown when there is no open session.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.SendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest)"></xref> method sends a single <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryRequest"></xref> object that contains the request.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DirectoryResponse"></xref> object that contains the results of the request.
request is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The DSML server returned an error response.
The operation returned a failure code.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.SendRequest(System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument)"></xref> method sends a <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object to the DSML server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlRequestDocument"></xref> object sent to the server.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlResponseDocument"></xref> object that contains the results of the request.
request is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.SessionId"></xref> property contains the active session ID.
The active session ID.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.SoapActionHeader"></xref> property contains the SOAP Action Header sent with other HTTP headers.
The default value of this property is "#batchRequest".
The SOAP Action Header sent with other HTTP headers.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection.Timeout"></xref> property contains the length of time, in seconds, before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> times out.
The length of time, in seconds, before the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlSoapHttpConnection"></xref> times out.
